meanings.definition: The practice of using tactics or strategies to gain an advantage in a game or competition.
meanings.sent1: His gamesmanship in chess tournaments always impressed his opponents.
meanings.sent2: She relied on her gamesmanship to win the tennis match.
meanings.sent3: The young boy's gamesmanship in hide-and-seek made him the champion of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: Her gamesmanship in negotiations was like a skilled magician performing tricks.
meanings.sent5: The coach's gamesmanship was so sharp that it felt like he could predict every move.

meanings.definition: The art of winning games or contests by using clever or cunning methods.
meanings.sent1: The magician's gamesmanship amazed the audience during the magic show.
meanings.sent2: He used his gamesmanship to outsmart his opponents in the board game.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's gamesmanship in gathering nuts was truly impressive.
meanings.sent4: Her gamesmanship in solving puzzles was like a masterful painter creating a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The detective's gamesmanship in solving cases was unmatched in the city.

meanings.definition: The skill or ability to manipulate or outwit opponents in a competitive situation.
meanings.sent1: His gamesmanship in debates always made him stand out as a strong contender.
meanings.sent2: She used her gamesmanship to navigate through the challenges of the obstacle course.
meanings.sent3: The cat's gamesmanship in catching mice was both impressive and amusing.
meanings.sent4: His gamesmanship in business was like a skilled archer hitting the bullseye every time.
meanings.sent5: The spy's gamesmanship in gathering information was crucial for the success of the mission.
